result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie Ray Ashford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Cash bail to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie Ray Ashford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time

Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford not in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is somewhat compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to Count 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. As to Count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months days in the House of Correction with credit for 24 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Cash bail to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Otain GED/HSED
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit and Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Court ordered Jury Trial date of 5/20/15 vacated. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however state requests more time as their file is unavailable. Court converted the Final Pretrial date of 5/4/2015 to a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A. Leija in court, defendant Jessie Ray Ashford not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
